About Zinfra: 

Zinfra is a leading partner in the design, build, operation and maintenance of Australia’s energy and utilities infrastructure. Delivering over $1B portfolio annually, the work we do is essential to bringing energy to our communities safely and reliably, while powering the nation’s energy transition. With a diverse workforce of more than 2,300, we expertly deliver our services across Australia.  

About the role:  

We’re hiring a Commercial Analyst to join our fast paced Commercial team to focus on strengthening contract performance by uniting financial data with contractual obligations to uncover trends, root causes, and commercial risks. Through clear, insightdriven recommendations, the role enhances profitability and improves decision making across the contract lifecycle. A key focus is modernising commercial operations by identifying opportunities for templatisation, automating claim workflows, and driving digitalisation. This enables real time commercial visibility and the development of scalable analytical tools. Ultimately, the role empowers the business with sharper commercial insights, greater operational efficiency, and stronger financial outcomes.  

Your responsibilities will include:  

Conducting insightful trend and root cause analysis across claims using financial and operational data to identify margin erosion factors and commercial risks.  
Generating clear commercial recommendations aligned with contractual obligations and operational realities, and producing concise commercial insight packs to support informed decision making.  
Building strong working relationships with Commercial, Finance, Process Improvement, Operations, and Digital teams under the sponsorship of the Senior Commercial Manager.  
Partnering with Commercial Managers to map workflows and define requirements for templatisation, workflow automation, and digitalisation of commercial processes.  
Supporting the design, testing, rollout, and adoption of digital commercial tools and automated workflows under the direction of senior commercial leaders.  
Developing training materials and delivering training to enable the effective adoption of improved commercial tools, templates, and digital processes.  
Identifying opportunities to enhance commercial operations through standardisation, automation, and improved use of digital platforms.  
Providing live commercial insights that strengthen contractual outcomes, performance visibility, and profitability.  
Contributing to the development of scalable commercial analytical tools that enhance efficiency and support continuous commercial improvement. 




About you:  

To be selected for interview, your profile should highlight a strong blend of analytical capability, commercial understanding, and process improvement experience, supported by sound data governance practices. You should demonstrate the ability to translate complex financial and contractual information into actionable insights that improve margin, strengthen decision making, and enhance overall commercial performance. 

Relevant qualification in finance, business, commerce, economics, or a related analytical discipline.  
Experience delivering detailed trend, root cause, and benchmark analyses to identify margin erosion factors and commercial risks.  
Time spent producing commercial insight packs and clear recommendations that improve operational decision making and contract performance.  
Knowledge of mapping, standardising, and enhancing commercial workflows, including contributing to templatisation and automation initiatives.  
Exposure to the design, testing, rollout, and adoption of digital commercial tools while applying strong data quality and governance practices. 

 

Why you should work for us  

What we do matters. Delivering safe and reliable energy makes a difference to people’s lives across our country every single day. We are proud to keep Australia connected while preparing the nation for a renewable future. Our people are our energy source. We offer meaningful benefits and rewards, including being a certified family-friendly workplace, flexible work arrangements, various leave benefits, career development pathways, a wellbeing program, and more.  

We know Zinfra is a great place to belong—but don’t just take our word for it; hear our team members share what working at Zinfra means to them.   

We champion and value diversity in life and work experiences, as we know everyone benefits from broader diversity of thoughts in our problem solving, decision making and ability to innovate. We encourage applications from everyone, including First Nations people, veterans, people living with a disability and members of the LGBTIQA+ community. If you need adjustments during the recruitment process, please let us know.  

Recruitment Process  

During our recruitment process, you may be required to undertake pre-employment checks including pre-employment medical, reference checks and a national police check.  

 

Notice to Third Parties: Zinfra does not accept unsolicited resumes (or liability associated with fees or costs) from recruitment agencies, search firms or third parties. Interested candidates are welcome to submit their application independently.

About ASL:

AusEnergy Services Limited (ASL) is an independent subsidiary of the Australian Energy Market Operator (or AEMO). ASL is at the heart of the energy transition, partnering with governments on critical infrastructure programs that are delivering the energy system of tomorrow, today. Purpose-built to fulfill this role, we are a trusted intermediary between governments and the private sector, creating a bridge between policy ambitions and the action that will deliver a net-zero energy system that benefits all Australians. ​ASL is committed to best-in-class service delivery for partner governments and continually building our relationships with stakeholders who deliver and support new infrastructure. ​This is a unique organisation, which is an important part of the Australian Energy Market Operator. You'll be tasked with solving novel and complex problems, adapting to ever evolving energy system needs and proactively considering how to enhance outcomes for consumers and taxpayers.​ You'll collaborate with the brightest and best minds, growing your skills whilst belonging to a highly respectful and inclusive culture, sharing the commitment to an essential purpose.  

As a fully flexible working organisation, ASL can consider applications across Australia, however preference may be given to Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane applicants for collaborative purposes. 

To find out more about our purpose, values and how we are bridging ambition and action to delivery the energy transition, please visit us here: https://asl.org.au/




About the Team:

The Commercial team’s ambition is to deliver energy transition in Australia at the lowest cost and risk to electricity consumers and government. The ASL commercial team contribute to this through competitive tenders, which deliver timely, high quality, energy infrastructure. For ASL’s tender delivery functions this means:

Tender design and end-to-end delivery of the tender process to support revenue underwriting of energy infrastructure for government schemes, including those of NSW, SA and Commonwealth governments
Working closely with Australian governments and private sector investors to establish relationships of trust. These relationships allow ASL to learn, educate, build awareness and gather insights for tender and product design refinements
Understand and support the commercial design of products and contracts (e.g. design LTESA, REZ access rights and in collaboration with government partners)
Understand and support the design and implementation of a robust probity and compliance frameworks in the tender process

Reporting to the Principal Advisor or Manager, the Senior Analyst, Commercial is responsible for preparing and delivering key elements of ASL’s commercial designs and the tenders.

Key Responsibilities:

Support the planning and delivering of important aspects of ASL’s tenders including commercial designs, tender collateral and tender analysis
Prepare high-quality written materials to facilitate tenders, inform and educate ASL stakeholders
Undertake commercial and technical analysis and comprehensive decision-making processes on policy positions with high levels of future uncertainty 
Undertake evaluation, due diligence and reporting across large numbers of tender submissions. This will involve exploring and supporting views on complex diligence issues
Support communication with tender proponents and communicate with other internal and external stakeholders (including government, banks and investors), to deliver ASL commercial objectives
Develop an understanding of and adhere to standards of governance and probity requirements in accordance with ASL’s processes
Demonstrate and apply basic risk and compliance assessment skills

Demonstrated experience within a similar role, contributing towards the delivery of complex projects or transactions within the renewable energy, private or Government industry
Demonstrated experience planning and contributing drafting to complex documents
Education qualifications in finance, law, engineering, economics or similar and/or equivalent work experience in financing or evaluating energy infrastructure projects
Strong interest in, and curiosity about, energy transition and/or renewable energy
Willingness, collaborative and accountable with excellent communication and business acumen
A solutions, client-oriented attitude and entrepreneurial spirit who thrives in a dynamic working environment

We value a curious mindset and the confidence to ask questions and challenge the status quo, as these attributes are key to success in this role.

Job Description


About the role:

The Senior Director of Finance & Strategy is a senior finance leader responsible for enterprise financial planning, performance management, and strategic execution. Reporting to the CFO, this role combines traditional company planning, reporting rigor, and KPI governance with modern systems building, embedded AI workflows, and advanced analytics capabilities.

This position will drive financial discipline while building scalable systems and intelligent workflows that enable data-driven decision-making across the organization.

What your day to day will look like:

1. Enterprise Planning & FP&A Leadership

Own the annual operating plan (AOP), long-range planning (LRP), and rolling forecast processes.
Lead company-wide budgeting, re-forecasting, and scenario modelling.
Develop driver-based financial models aligned to SaaS metrics (ARR, NRR, CAC, LTV, gross margin, churn).
Deliver executive-ready reporting for CFO, CEO, and Board.
Ensure forecast accuracy, strong variance analysis, and forward-looking risk assessment.

2. Reporting, Metrics & KPI Governance

Establish and govern enterprise KPI frameworks aligned to company strategy.
Ensure consistency in definitions and integrity across financial and operational metrics.
Collaborate with RevOps on monthly and quarterly business reviews with clear performance narratives.
Drive accountability across functions through data transparency and measurable targets.

3. Strategic Finance & Corporate Strategy

Partner with the CFO to translate strategy into measurable financial outcomes.
Steward capital allocation analysis, pricing strategy, unit economics optimization, and investment prioritization.
Build business cases for product launches, market expansion, and strategic initiatives.
Support potential M&A evaluation and integration planning as needed.

4. Systems Building & Workflow Optimization

Design and implement scalable finance systems and processes.
Oversee ERP, planning systems, and reporting tools optimization.
Integrate automation and AI into finance workflows (forecasting, reconciliations, reporting, scenario planning).
Improve operational efficiency by reducing manual processes and increasing system integration.
Partner with Engineering and Data teams to ensure financial systems integrate seamlessly into the broader tech stack.
 

5. Data, Analytics & AI Enablement

Build and oversee a modern financial data architecture with a single source of truth.
Leverage advanced analytics and AI to enhance forecasting accuracy and predictive modeling.
Embed AI into workflow decision-making (e.g., automated variance explanations, anomaly detection, cash flow prediction).
Promote data governance, reporting accuracy, and analytical rigor across the organization.
 

6. Stakeholder Management

Serve as a trusted advisor to the CFO and executive leadership team.
Partner closely with Revenue, Product, Operations, and Engineering leaders.
Present financial insights in a clear, strategic, and decision-oriented manner.
Support external stakeholder interactions including Board and investors where applicable.

7. Team Leadership

Lead and develop the FP&A and strategic finance teams.
Strengthen financial acumen across the organization.
Build scalable processes and team structures to support growth.

Qualifications


 What you need to succeed:

10+ years of progressive finance experience, including senior FP&A or strategic finance leadership.
Strong experience in SaaS environments, with a solid understanding of recurring revenue models, subscription metrics and unit economics is required.
Experience with embedded fintech models (e.g., payments, capital, billing infrastructure) is considered an advantage.
Experience implementing and enhancing finance systems and processes.
Experience embedding AI and automation into finance workflows.
Advanced financial modeling and analytical skills.
Exceptional executive communication and stakeholder management capabilities.
